section.title: Tips
section.p: The verbosity of the task logging can be increased by using the -v flag. For even more verbosity -vv can be used. Eg. $ boot -v build
In the REPL you use it like this (1-3, increasing verbosity): (reset! boot.util/*verbosity* 2) (boot (build))

Suppose you do boot -v foobar and you get a stack trace. You can then do boot -vb |cat -n and see the matching line numbers. Actually you should do boot -vb foobar to get the exact same generated code; just add -b to the thing that caused the error.

boot show is your friend. remember: itâ€™s a task. that means you can insert it in anywhere in a pipeline in order to dump useful info to stdout. For example, boot show -f my-task show -f will print the before and after filesets for my-task.
